solution_line_template: Christian just mowed {christian_yards} yards at ${christian_yard_rate} each so he made {christian_yards}*{christian_yard_rate} = $<<{christian_yards}*{christian_yard_rate}={christian_earned}>>{christian_earned}
Sue just walked {sue_dogs} dogs at ${sue_dog_rate} each so she made {sue_dogs}*{sue_dog_rate} = $<<{sue_dogs}*{sue_dog_rate}={sue_earned}>>{sue_earned}

Christian had ${christian_saved} saved and just made ${christian_earned} while Sue had ${sue_saved} saved and just made ${sue_earned} so together they had {christian_saved}+{christian_earned}+{sue_saved}+{sue_earned} = $<<{christian_saved}+{christian_earned}+{sue_saved}+{sue_earned}={total_money}>>{total_money}

The perfume cost ${perfume_cost} and they had ${total_money} so they needed to make {perfume_cost}-{total_money} = $<<{perfume_cost}-{total_money}={additional_needed}>>{additional_needed} more dollars
